WYSIWYM.transformer
Class ContentPlanner

java.lang.Object
  WYSIWYM.transformer.ContentPlanner
Direct Known Subclasses:
QueryResultPlanner, TextTypesPlanner
public class ContentPlanner
extends Object

ContentPlanner plans the text; it creates a text plan from a semantic graph.

Version:
1.4 2008/07/25
Author:
Feikje Hielkema

makeParagraphs

protected List<SGNode> makeParagraphs()
Determines the minimum number of paragraphs needed in the text. Each paragraph describes a node in the graph.

Returns:
List with individuals that should be paragraphs

lexicalise

protected List<DependencyTreeTransformer> lexicalise(SGNode topic)

lexicalise

protected List<DependencyTreeTransformer> lexicalise(SGNode topic,
                                                     boolean relativeClause)
Lexicalises all edges of this node that haven't been added to a previous paragraph, and returns a list with the resulting dependency trees. If a node has >1 instance of the same property, these edges are already coordinated. Although it would be neater to do it in aggregate(), this would mean wasting time on generating dependency trees that are then searched, combined and thrown away.

Parameters:
topic - The SGNode that is the topic of the paragraph
Returns:
List

lexicaliseEdge

protected DependencyTreeTransformer lexicaliseEdge(SGNode topic,
                                                   SGEdge edge,
                                                   boolean relativeClause)

makeSummation

public static DTNode makeSummation(int size,
                                   String label,
                                   DependencyTreeTransformer dt)
Creates a summation node, a DTNode that summarises >4 edges of the same property (e.g. 'this state contains 23 cities).

Parameters:
size - Number of summarised edges
label - Property name
dt - DependencyTreeTransformer to add summation node to
Returns:
DTNode summation node
